body.p: Forms are generated for us by the Eclipse Rich Ajax Platform. Therefore, we do not directly create HTML in order to add a form field. Instead we need to edit the form definition in Java.

All controls, including the forms for editing data, are found in the uk.ac.osswatch.simal.controls package. Forms for editing objects are called [OBJECT-NAME]EditorViewPart. So, in this case, we need to work with uk.ac.osswatch.simal.controls.ProjectEditorViewPart.

The method public void createPartControl(final Composite parent) is the method responsible for the creation of the form components. So this is where we add our field. There is a helper class that provides methods for constructing fields for us, we will use this helper class to make our form code simpler.
